channel.title: BBC News - News front page
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Firm in data scandal 'made election boasts'
item.description: The company that became Cambridge Analytica boasted about interfering in foreign elections, according to documents seen by the Sunday Politics.

item.title: Hawaii missile alert: False alarm warning broadcast
item.description: A false missile alert was broadcast in Hawaii urging people to take shelter.

item.title: Dealing with debt: The mini-bankers learning how to save
item.description: Schoolchildren from Kirton Primary in Boston run their own bank with its own currency to learn about saving money.

item.title: EgyptAir hijack: Man jumps from plane cockpit window
item.description: A man was filmed jumping from a hijacked EgyptAir plane cockpit window shortly before the hijacker surrendered.

item.title: EgyptAir hijack: Cyprus president laughs off hijacking
item.description: Cyprus President Nicos Anastasiades has said that the hijacking of the plane that landed at Larnaca was not linked to terrorism.

item.title: Armed man shot by police at US Capitol building
item.description: Police shot an armed man as he tried to enter the Capitol building visitor centre in Washington DC.

item.title: How did FBI unlock dead gunman's iPhone?
item.description: The FBI has managed to unlock the iPhone of the San Bernardino gunman without Apple's help, ending a court case, the US justice department says.

item.title: Library cuts: How flagship building made savings
item.description: Birmingham's new Â£189m library had to shed staff and reduce hours within two years of opening.

item.title: Israel on alert for attacks by Islamic State fighters in Sinai
item.description: With so-called Islamic State militants active in Egypt's Sinai, Israeli troops are on alert for attacks just across the border.

item.title: Fire engulfs tower block in UAE city Ajman
item.description: A fire has broken out in a tower block in the city of Ajman in the United Arab Emirates.

item.title: Inside Aleppo province: On the ground with Kurdish forces fighting IS
item.description: The BBC gains exclusive access in Aleppo province, where Kurdish forces have seized most of the border with Turkey from Islamic State fighters.

item.title: Bouncy castle victim 'a beautiful angel'
item.description: The parents of Summer Grant, seven, who died when the bouncy castle she was playing on blew away have been paying tribute to her.

item.title: What Katie did: Storm damage across London
item.description: Wind gusts of up to 105 mph (170 kph) from Storm Katie have caused Gatwick-bound flights to be diverted, and damage across London.

item.title: Drone reveals ancient city 'still standing'
item.description: Drone footage has revealed that the ancient city of Palmyra is largely still intact, after being recaptured from so-called Islamic State (IS).

item.title: Syria crisis: Refugees 'fascinated' by mobility scooter
item.description: The BBC's disability news correspondent, Nikki Fox, has been to the camp to see how those with a disability, who are some of the most vulnerable, survive.

item.title: Pants for fishing nets: How stranded WW2 crew survived
item.description: The family of an RAF flight officer relives their father's wartime tale of survival.
